name: ADA Compliance Details and Local Regulations
description: Comprehensive guide to ADA compliance and local accessibility regulations for ramps, handrails, and home modifications in Buffalo, Kenmore, Tonawanda, North Tonawanda, and Cheektowaga.

mainEntity.name: Do I need a permit to install a ramp in Buffalo?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, most municipalities require permits for any structural modification, including ramps. Aaron Michael Services handles permitting for you.

mainEntity.name: What slope is allowed for ramps?

acceptedAnswer.text: The maximum slope allowed by ADA is 1:12, which means 1 inch of rise for every 12 inches of run.
Yes, handrails are required on both sides for ramps that rise more than 6 inches, with heights between 34 and 38 inches.
ADA mandates a minimum ramp width of 36 inches for single-user ramps to accommodate wheelchairs safely.

mainEntity.name: How often should I inspect my ramps?

acceptedAnswer.text: Monthly inspections are recommended, with additional checks after storms or heavy snow.
